text: @michaelmurrayca @BadDayOnline @LocalScienceJew @zrahul2020 @AliceFromQueens That sounds like a you problem. The USA is built on centuries of slavery of non-white people. The rebellion of 1776 was a pro-slavery rebellion! We are all touched by racism, we were born into a racist culture. Sorry if you feel personally insulted by that.

@angel_sentbyGod @BadDayOnline @LocalScienceJew @zrahul2020 @AliceFromQueens No. The word cannot even be thought, let alone said. For me, as a white child, I learned that the worst thing I could be called was a white supremacist or racist. I was not hurling the slurs, I was mortified by the thought of it. The worst thing you could call me was racist.

@michaelmurrayca @BadDayOnline @LocalScienceJew @zrahul2020 @AliceFromQueens What? If you're white, the N word is strictly off limits. Racist is a normal word in comparison. I think your parents probably should have explained this.
@michaelmurrayca @BadDayOnline @LocalScienceJew @zrahul2020 @AliceFromQueens I'm pretty sure the N word is a worse slur

@BadDayOnline @LocalScienceJew @zrahul2020 @AliceFromQueens I had white guilt before I hit 10, was raised to believe being called a racist was the worst slur a person could possibly hurl. If you make that charge, you better have the receipts.

"No such thing as cancel culture" ppl are quiet on the Jeopardy thing, for good reason.

Their schtick requires treating each new cancel frenzy as an isolated case, a fringe excess.

But "these hundreds of normie Jeopardy contestants are from a radical fringe" won't fly.
